intro: Cynoglossum cyaneum, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Cynoglossum cyaneum is a member of the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its medicinal and ornamental plants.
